revised_title: Observations and Treatment of a Cow Distemper
tldr: The author describes their observations and experiments on a disease affecting cows, which they believe to be a form of peripneumony or inflammation of the lungs, windpipe, and nostrils. They suggest a treatment method involving the use of Crocus Metallorum, warm mashes, and other remedies. The cause of the disease remains uncertain, but the author believes it may be contagious and recommends keeping herds separate to prevent its spread.
